title: 105_hr1226
content: The "Taxpayer Browsing Protection Act" is introduced with penalties for unauthorized inspection of tax returns or information under section 7213A of the Internal Revenue Code. The "Taxpayer Browsing Protection Act" prohibits unauthorized inspection of tax returns or information by federal employees, state employees, or other individuals. Violation of this law can result in a fine of up to $1,000, imprisonment for up to 1 year, or both. The "Taxpayer Browsing Protection Act" prohibits unauthorized inspection of tax returns or information by federal employees, state employees, or other individuals. Violators can face fines, imprisonment, or dismissal from office or employment for federal officers or employees. Technical amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code to enforce this law. The amendments made by this section apply to violations occurring on and after the date of the enactment of this Act. The amendments to section 7431 of the Internal Revenue Code include changes to civil damages for unauthorized inspection or disclosure. This applies to violations occurring after the enactment of the Act. The amendments to section 7431 of the Internal Revenue Code address civil damages for unauthorized inspection or disclosure, with exceptions for good faith errors in interpretation of section 6103 and inspections requested by the taxpayer. The amendments to section 7431 of the Internal Revenue Code address civil damages for unauthorized inspection or disclosure, with exceptions for good faith errors in interpretation of section 6103 and inspections requested by the taxpayer. The amendments include changes to definitions and terminology related to inspections and disclosures. Amendments to section 7431 of the Internal Revenue Code now include allowing civil damages for unauthorized inspection or disclosure, with exceptions for good faith errors and taxpayer-requested inspections. Effective immediately, the changes apply to inspections and disclosures after the enactment of this Act. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
